intro: Gonostegia pentandra var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender leafed gonostegia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and small, clustered flowers with distinctive yellow petals. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany and horticulture.
